ygData.subject: Re: Ideas for a low level newbie?
ygData.msgSnippet: I hunt from Qeynos and just went through 7 and 8 - my longest levels so far. There is an old Qeynos warrior saying: West Karanas for xp; Black Burrow for
ygData.messageBody:
I hunt from Qeynos and just went through 7 and 8 - my longest levels so far.

There is an old Qeynos warrior saying: "West Karanas for xp; Black Burrow
for loot." (Well, it's 2 weeks old anyways :-)

At Lev 7 you should be ok in BB as long as you stay smart (do not go into
the tree on the top floor!) You have to kill whatever you attack - if you
let one run away, he comes back with 3 or 4 of his pals! If you run with 3
or 4 chasing you, you have formed a "train" and the top floor dudes don't
like it when someone drags a train up top and then zones. Also, if you
attack the "caboose" of a train, you stand a good chance that the whole
train will turn on you. And then there are kill and loot stealers and
whiners - the PC are almost as bad as the NPC at times but if you learn your
way around and pick the correct fights - the loot is good. You should be
able to get some 2 h weps in BB after a short bit of work.

Out on the Karanas, stay away from the bandits and scarecrows and anything
else that cons red to you. You can build great xp on bears without any
hassle from Cros or Holly. Then work the young cats and by late 8 you
should be able to solo on some of the big cats - con everything and read the
writing as well as looking at the color. Use the ruined cat pelts to make
patchwork armor. Sell the rest.

Good luck and good hunting,

Snyak.

-----Original Message-----
From: Eddie Tepania [mailto:grifter0153@...]
Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 9:07 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Ideas for a low level
newbie?

From: Eddie Tepania <grifter0153@...>

I cant really offer an opinion on the Weapon side beyond try
getting a
couple of long swords or scimitars to dual weild. Dual
wield REALLY drinks
your stamina at first. Mino axes do more damage but they
also weigh a lot
more.
As far as skills and training points go
check this page.. they have a few player guides up and its
still being
constructed
www.geocities.com/SouthBeach/Cove/1261

the warrior guide is up at least and it might help you on a
few points.

Kelly Pruett wrote:

> From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
>
> Hi all. I've trolled this list a little and you guys all
seem to give
> great advice. I was wondering if you could guide a first
time EQ player
> on his future...
>
> I'm a level 7 human warrior in Qeynos:
> Max 1H-Slash for my level
> Max Kick for my level
> Max Sense Direction for my level
> 30+ Offense
> 20+ Defense
> 10 or so Bash
> 1 in 1H-Bashing
> 1 in 2H-Slashing (No weapon yet)
> 0 in Hand-to-Hand
> 3 in Bind Wounds (I never use it)
> 30+ Fishing
> 10+ Tailoring (Great combo with the fishing. I make money
for the
> patterns)
>
> My question is what skills/weapons should I actively
pursue more than
> others?? I've guessed so far just from things I've read on
the net.
> Should I ever put more than one practice in a weapon??
>
> Thanks in advance for replies,
>
> Faderic of Ellorisi Mar
>
>
